results.title: Airline Career Placement Specialist
results.description:
**REMOTE CST/EST ONLY**

About Us

ATP is the nation's largest flight school, providing students with the most efficient path to a successful airline pilot career. For over 35 years, ATP has been the leader in professional flight training and supplying pilots to regional and major airlines.

The role

The Airline Career Placement Specialist is primarily responsible for proactive outreach and career placement assistance to ATP CFIs and Alumni. The Airline Career Placement Specialist will also identify placement opportunities for graduates, complete Pilot Record Improvement Act (PRIA) requests, and capture graduate placement data, while acting as the initial point of contact for communications to ATP Career Services.

Responsibilities

  • Answer and screen incoming calls to ATP Career Services
  • Assist Manager of Career Services with initial review of ATP student and graduate resumes
  • Source and review pilot job listings on PilotPool.com
  • Provide proactive outreach to graduates to educate and promote ATP Alumni Association, external placement assistance resources
  • Promptly resolve ATPAlumni.org registration and FIRC support requests.
  • Complete employment and/or education verifications for 1099 Independent Contractors
  • Utilize employment and/or education verifications and CTP scheduling data to assist in accurate tracking of graduate placements
  • Respond to Airline Career Pilot Program reviews from Alumni
  • Solicit program testimonials and photos from Alumni
  • Conduct routine Career Services outreach to low time instructors
  • Provide administrative support reconciling partnership record releases
  • Maintain airline profile databases and ensure content accuracy on airline partnership landing pages on a routine, monthly basis.
  • Completes other duties as assigned
  • Travel may be required, as needed

Qualifications

  • High school required. Some college coursework or degree in business, communications, aviation, marketing or related fields are preferred. 
  • Minimum two (2) years' experience in a flight education or aviation role. 
  • Prior knowledge of Pilot Records Improvement Act (PRIA) preferred. 
  • Computer proficiency required; experience with ATP software and systems preferred. 
  • Some travel required.

 Benefits

ATP offers a comprehensive employee benefits program, including:

  • Starting pay commensurate with experience
  • $15,000 Employer Paid Life Insurance
  • Medical coverage 
  • Dental/Vision/Life Insurance
  • Critical Illness and Accident Insurance
  • Short-Term and Long-Term Disability Insurance
  • 401(k) Enrollment (100% Vested with no employer contributions)
  • 8 Paid Holidays (New Year's Day, Memorial Day, Independence Day, Labor Day, Thanksgiving Day, Thanksgiving Friday, Christmas Eve and Christmas Day)
  • 13 Paid Time Off Days per Year (PTO is earned on an accrual-basis)

Physical Demands

  • The physical demands described here must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. The employee is regularly required to talk, hear, see, stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms, lift and/or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.

ATP is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.

results.title: Healthcare Sales Recruiter
results.description:
Potential to earn $40,000-$120,000 in your first year with average recruiters making $120,000-$200,000 in the second year!

 

 

As part of the Host Healthcare Recruitment team, the Senior Recruiter drives successful placements of clinicians on assignment across multiple healthcare specialties and clients. Senior Recruiters develop strong relationships with clinicians nationwide through proactive outreach efforts to recruit and place them in open temporary job opportunities aligned with their clinical and specialty experience across health systems, acute care hospitals, outpatient clinics, home health organizations and more.

 

The successful Senior Recruiter is self-motivated, with a strong desire to meet or exceed placement goals and passion for helping clinicians to thrive in their careers. The recruiter is a creative, energetic individual with excellent interpersonal communication skills and professional demeanor and maturity. The Senior Recruiter maintains a positive outlook and serves as a positive influence within the team. He or she is also well-organized, comfortable working in a fast-paced environment, and exhibits Host’s core values of Team Strength, Personal Accountability, Leading with Integrity, Driven by Excellence, Embracing Positivity and Mastering Our Craft.

 

 

Essential Duties & Responsibilities:

• Consistently meets and/or exceeds sales goals by driving new placements and retention of clinicians on assignment.

• Actively prospects, pre-screens and activates candidate leads through cold calling, email and text blasting. Identifies relevant open job opportunities that match the candidate’s specialty experience and professional interests.

• Understands clinician job requirements. Creates compelling candidate profiles for submission to hiring managers. Follows up daily on active candidate submissions and collaborates with account managers to ensure candidates move rapidly through the hiring process.

• Ensures interviews are scheduled and works with account managers to solicit assignment and extension offers on behalf of candidates. Able to pre-close and close offers with candidates to drive offer acceptance.

• Maintains strong rapport with clinicians on assignment to ensure a positive experience and actively drives assignment extensions and rebooking of clinicians at other facilities. Assists in resolving service or credentialing issues that may arise.

• Accurately enters all candidate and placement activity into the Host Healthcare database.

 

 

Qualifications:

• High school diploma required. Bachelor’s degree preferred.

• Previous sales experience and/or healthcare knowledge preferred.

• Excellent verbal and written communications. Able to negotiate and problem-solve collaboratively with candidates and internal team members.

• Excellent time management and prioritization skills. Able to maintain an organized, well-run sales desk and meet required turnaround times. Comfortable within in a fast-paced work environment.

• High comfort level operating within technology platforms (e.g., Target Recruit)

 

 

Benefits and Compensation:

• Uncapped commission!

• Benefits on day 1 (medical, dental, vision) and company-paid life insurance; short and long-term disability; supplemental life insurance for yourself, spouse & child(ren); and multiple voluntary benefits [Hawaii residents receive benefits on the first day of the month following hire date!]

• Eligible for 401K after 6 months of hire - company match at 1 year!

• Remote work option - work from anywhere in the United States

• We provide your equipment (laptop, monitors, headset, etc.)

• Discounted gym memberships

• Flexible PTO

• 10 paid holidays

• Training programs for growth and development

• Employee Assistance Program (EAP)

• Pet insurance - don't forget about our furry friends!

results.title: Vice President of People
results.description:
Our health system is broken, and it’s a huge problem. Costs are rising out of control while the patient experience gets worse. At Sana, we're passionate about fixing this problem by bringing accessible and affordable health plans to small and medium businesses. We've built an innovative team with top talent from across the health insurance and tech industries to create engaging, modern plans for our clients. This allows our customers to offer competitive benefits packages while paying an average of 20% less than traditional plans.
 
We are seeking a VP of People to own the entire end-to-end employee experience, including talent acquisition, compensation planning, benefits, compliance, engagement, performance, recognition, career-pathing, retention, and company culture. You will be an integral member of the senior leadership team and meetings, reporting to the Chief Operating Officer and partnering closely with the CEO and executive team to build a high-impact team as the company scales. The ideal candidate brings a passion for attracting and retaining top talent while fostering a culture that promotes a growth mindset, humility, drive, collaboration, and inclusion. We are looking for a strong leader with innovative ideas and deep experience to support our organization.
 
We are building a diverse, talented and remote team and encourage you to apply! However we are not able to offer sponsorship at this time, and all applicants should be authorized to work in the US.



What you will do
  • Own the strategic vision for our People Team at Sana. You will lead a critical aspect of Sana’s business and work cross-functionally to craft a plan building upon our strategic priorities. 
  • Lead and continue to build a high performing team consisting of recruiters, people operations staff, talent management, and other roles yet to be hired.
  • Develop and foster plans for your team members’ continued career growth through regular coaching, consistent 1:1s, feedback sessions, and Q&A. 
  • Talent Acquisition. Responsible for attracting and recruiting top talent to support business objectives, with a strong focus on diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging (DEIB) in hiring practices. Own and expand our employer brand in collaboration with Marketing. 
  • Talent Development. Create a learning and development strategy that provides employees at all levels with a clear pathway for continuous professional growth. Serve as a consultant to leadership and management on HR-related issues while acting as an employee champion and change agent.
  • Performance Management. Build overall company performance philosophy and guide leaders across the company on organizational design and development, leadership, employee engagement and retention, performance measurement, coaching, and succession planning. 
  • People Operations. Manage and optimize global people systems, processes, and policies. Serve as the "center of excellence" for every moment in the employee lifecycle and the go-to for employee questions.
  • Compensation & Benefits. Build and refine a total compensation program that offers employees a comprehensive package that is informed by industry benchmarking, tailored to Sana’s remote culture, is competitive within the market, and meets business requirements and budgets.
  • People Data Insights. Identify, track, and report on key performance indicators for recruiting, retention, DEIB, compensation, performance, engagement, and other critical metrics that align to broader business objectives and priorities.
  • Work closely with the Finance team across a range of programs, including compensation planning, performance cycles, equity management, payroll, benefits planning, budgeting, IT procurement, and compliance. 
  • Ensure compliance with employment, benefits, insurance, safety, and other laws, regulations, and requirements.
  • Provide guidance and leadership to the People team while also assisting with the resolution of HR, compensation, and benefits questions, concerns, and issues as they arise.



About you
  • 10+ years of relevant experience, preferably with 3+ years in a fast-growth company environment in the health, wellness, and/or benefits space at a leadership level.
  • An inspirational leader and excellent people manager with a passion for team-building. You know how to identify, recruit, and maximize your team’s talent. People love working with and for you.
  • Exceptional analytical skills with a demonstrated ability to look at key performance metrics and employee/benefits data on a regular basis to find trends, drill-down into cases as needed, and to take data-informed action accordingly. Experience using business intelligence tools such as Tableau is a plus.
  • Outstanding emotional intelligence and communication skills over zoom, cell, email, chat, carrier pigeon, etc.
  • Direct experience scaling organizations efficiently and effectively, with ability to anticipate and proactively support various growth-related challenges.
  • Working knowledge of relevant employment laws and regulations and how to practically apply them in the workplace.
  • Values-oriented. You care deeply about making our healthcare system work better for people and business owners.
  • Unparalleled attention to detail. You love getting into the weeds to get things done.
  • Fast learner. Entrepreneurial. Self-directed. Excited to build something from scratch.
  • Gritty. You aren’t worried about getting your hands dirty and working hard when you need to.
Our cash compensation amount for this role is targeted at $200,000 to $250,000 per year for all US-based remote locations. Final offer amounts are determined by multiple factors including candidate experience and expertise and may vary from the amounts listed above.
 
About Sana
Sana is a modern health plan solution for small and medium businesses. We use a more efficient financing structure and integrated technology solutions to cut out wasteful spending and get members access to better quality care at lower cost. Founded in 2017, we are an experienced team of engineers, designers and health system operators. We have the financial backing of Silicon Valley venture firms and innovative reinsurance partners. If you are excited about building something new and being a part of fixing our broken healthcare system from the inside, please reach out!

results.title: Coach Facilitator, Talent Development
results.description:
We are looking for a part-time Coach Facilitator, Talent Development to join our Talent Development Team. You will be reporting to the Director, Talent Development.  As the Coach Facilitator, Talent Development, you will take on ownership of the Coaching offering that facilitates personal and professional growth opportunities for all BenchSciers. You will assess needs, design and launch a variety of coaching offerings  (eg, coaching circles, workshops, self-guided resources and job aids) in an effort to meet the growing needs of the organization.
 
BenchSci is a remote-first organization. At this moment, we are welcoming applicants from Canada for this position.



You Will:
  • Contribute to the design of coaching programs, workshops, tools, and curricula that deliver a high-quality learner experience and support the Talent Development strategy aiming to develop BenchSciers and facilitate their professional and personal growth journeys. 
  • Facilitate group and individual coaching sessions to support the development of People Leaders within the Leadership Academy. 
  • Assess, plan, monitor, and evaluate all Coaching offerings and ensure they are aligned with defined business goals and competency gaps based on available data.
  • Identify insights from evaluation data to continuously iterate and improve offerings.
  • Leverage and build internal Culture relationships to enhance the optimization and implementation of Talent Development programs and initiatives.
  • Consult on, and build frameworks and content to support the development of Coaching deliverables (e.g., 360s, feedback frameworks etc).
  • Respond to the ad hoc business needs of BenchSciers for 1:1 support. 
  • Provide ad hoc Talent Development program support based on critical needs.



You Have:
  • 3-5 years of coaching and facilitation experience. 
  • ICF certified Experience facilitating Personality Testing and results workshops (ie. Facet5 or something similar) 
  • Highly proficient with MS Excel, with the ability to analyze data, report on programs and create monthly/quarterly reports. 
  • Proven ability to cope effectively with change and manage priorities in a fast-paced, results-oriented work environment.
  • You’re ready to roll up your sleeves to achieve results.
  • You are responsible for your own success and take accountability for your actions and can track your part-time efforts accordingly. 
  • Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to build strong relationships and trust.
  • Strong attention to detail and a high degree of accuracy (specific to note-taking).
  • Self-driven and action-oriented with the ability to consistently follow through.
  • Innovative, creative, and constantly looking for ways to improve and optimize processes.
  • A natural facilitator with the ability to form effective working relationships with people at all levels of the organization.
Benefits and Perks: 
An engaging remote-first culture 
A great compensation package that includes BenchSci equity options
Comprehensive health and dental benefits
$1000 CAD*  home office set-up budget
 A lifestyle spending account that covers eligible expenses for wellness, lifestyle, and productivity
*Generous parental leave benefits with a top-up plan or paid time off options

About BenchSci:
BenchSci's vision is to help scientists bring novel medicine to patients 50% faster by 2025. We empower scientists to run more successful experiments with the world's most advanced, biomedical artificial intelligence software platform. 
Backed by F-Prime, Inovia, Golden Ventures, and Google's AI fund, Gradient Ventures, we provide an indispensable tool for scientists that accelerates research at 16 top 20 pharmaceutical companies and over 4,300 leading academic centers. We're a certified Great Place to Work®, and top-ranked company on Glassdoor.
 
Our Culture:
BenchSci relentlessly builds on its strong foundation of culture. We put team members first, knowing that they're the organization's beating heart. We invest as much in our people as our products. Our culture fosters transparency, collaboration, and continuous learning. 
We value each other's differences and always look for opportunities to embed equity into the fabric of our work. We foster diversity, autonomy, and personal growth, and provide resources to support motivated self-leaders in continuous improvement. 
You will work with high-impact, highly skilled, and intelligent experts motivated to drive impact and fulfill a meaningful mission. We empower you to unleash your full potential, do your best work, and thrive. Here you will be challenged to stretch yourself to achieve the seemingly impossible.  Learn more about our culture.

results.title: Talent and Culture Lead
results.description:
Our mission: Make meetings better, for everybody

 

At Bizly, we want to turn meetings into the amazing sources of productivity, connection, and happiness they were meant to be. Our robust meeting-building platform gives organizations everything they need to plan and run gatherings to actually accomplish that. Now we need you.

 

We’re hiring our Talent and Culture Lead

 

We’re welcoming more humans to our leadership team to grow our capabilities, reach, and impact—and to change the fate of meetings forever.   This role is the first of its kind at Bizly, designed for an experienced leader who has expertise in sourcing and hiring top talent in product, engineering, and business roles; as well as has implemented operational processes to keep everyone performing at their best and aligned to the mission of the Company.   

 

The ideal candidate is highly tactical and data-oriented around sourcing candidates through a combination of lead generation sources and leveraging company networks, and as a track record of culture-building at fast growth technology companies. 

 

Job Expectations

 

Your job every morning when you wake up is to help us source the best talent imaginable, helping us punch far above our weight.  Second, it’s to support our other Company leaders with establishing best practices for hiring their own roles, assisting them with holding their teams accountable, and nurturing individual team cultures while connecting them back to the Company mission.   You are a believer that we bring our “whole selves” to work each day and you are passionate about unlocking everyone’s potential with a holistic approach.

 

 

We need someone to

 

  • Recruit

  • Own the tactical sourcing, vetting, interview, and negotiation/hiring process

  • Develop novel processes and tools for sourcing candidates including use of both digital and personal tactics

  • Holding recruiting accountable to both qualitative and quantitative measures

  • Establish our own “best-in-class” benchmarks in the SaaS category

  • Create a world-class culture 

  • Own, operationalize, and strengthen the Company culture

  • Develop and implement a thoughtful approach to culture

  • Unlock the potential of our talent

  • Develop and implement performance management for talent; creating an internal dashboard for the leadership team and board of directors

  • Implement a “holistic approach” to talent management, cultivating our talent through training, education, coaching, mentoring, and other techniques as relevant for each role/department

  • Experiment with tactics and strategies, playing at the cutting edge of the latest research in talent management

 

What you can bring to Bizly

 

  • 6+ years of experience in operations, HR, recruiting, or talent management

  • You must have deep SaaS expertise, particularly in VC-backed companies with user-facing applications

  • The ability to teach the CEO and all Bizly leaders about recruiting best practices  

  • The ability to leverage the relationship networks of the Bizly team and investors to accrue benefits to the organization

  • A tactical “roll up the sleeves” approach to the work, being able to work independently to create results 

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

 

You’re the kind of person who

 

  • Is a SaaS specialist who keeps on top of all the latest innovations, trends, news, and happenings in the SaaS (and preferably productivity SaaS) space 

  • Is an excellent storyteller who uses an objective data-oriented approach to influence 

  • Is passionate about technology and improving a problem faced by millions 

  • Knows what it takes to win in a startup environment

 

Inclusivity is central to our company, product, and mission. If you’re passionate, dedicated, and unafraid to change the status quo, we encourage you to apply, even if your experience isn’t an exact fit. At Bizly you’ll have the opportunity to grow, space to be yourself, and ownership over your success, not to mention a few perks. It’s an exciting time to get in early and make an impact. Show us what you got!

 

Psst: We are based in the Bay Area but are fully remote-friendly for this and all roles

results.title: Technical Recruiter
results.description:
This is a remote permanent employment role for people based in Canada (ET or CT Time Zones).

 

The Opportunity 

Growing and dynamic organizations are fueled and driven by passionate and intellectually curious people. We’re looking to add more NearFormers who fit this profile. At NearForm we are in the fortunate position of having 10 years of experience delivering on mission critical outcomes for our customers, while still retaining the start-up feel, transparency, and intimacy of a close knit community of technologists.   

We build digital products that provide users of these products fantastic digital experiences and allow enterprises to go to market faster, improve customer experience, while transforming their workflows and advancing our clients’ digital agendas. With a recent significant investment into the business, NearForm is poised to scale its impact to more enterprises. 

Are you the right person to fuel this growth and add to a wonderfully collaborative culture?  

The Role

We are scaling at a very fast pace and the Talent team is the engine at the centre of our growth plans. We are an experienced team with a good understanding of how to hire great Engineering talent while being open to fresh ideas and perspectives - we like to foster a culture of continuous improvement in everything we do.

We’re looking for a hands on Technical Recruiter in Canada to help our expansion plans.  This will be an individual contributor role as a member of a very collaborative team.

Key Requirements

Our Ideal Candidate:

  • Self starter who can work proactively and autonomously
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills
  • Comfortable working in a remote-first culture
  • Provide an add to our culture; bringing energy, empathy, and fun to work daily
  • Ability to work across multiple roles and streams
  • A good networker with demonstrable experience building long term relationships with candidates
  • Strong stakeholder management skills and a consultative approach

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Sourcing and attracting candidates
  • Manage the full recruitment life cycle with an emphasis on great candidate experience
  • Collaborate with internal teams to develop sourcing and attraction strategies to drive top talent to NearForm
  • Identify recruitment market trends and tools

Experience Guidelines:

  • You should be comfortable working in a fast paced environment
  • You should have experience hiring software engineering roles and know what good looks like
  • Familiarity using Sourcing tools and applicant tracking systems to manage active and passive candidate pools

Benefits

  • Employee Benefits
  • Work remotely; we have a genuine dedication to work/life balance. 
  • Work flexibly; we appreciate there are more important things in life than work so our flexible working culture allows you to work around what matters - school run, no problem!
  • The Wellness Hub: We have a genuine commitment to fostering/improving NearFormers’ wellbeing.

Although we are widely dispersed, NearFormers are a tightly-knit team. We trust one another and care about our colleagues. Building on our open-source origins, we promote the sharing of thoughts, knowledge and ideas.

results.title: Junior Recruiter/Talent Acquisition
results.description:
After another very exciting year of rapid growth, FXC Intelligence are looking to add a Junior Recruiter to their growing Talent Acquisition team. This is going to be the business’ second Talent Acquisition hire and it would be an ideal fit for someone who is at the start of their recruitment career and is looking to develop their skills in an in-house recruitment setting.

We are a fast growing fintech company providing financial data to an enterprise client list of household brands, which include HSBC, PayPal, World Bank, Western Union and MasterCard among others. We are rapidly building on our already strong reputation in the finance sector, and as a result, most of our recent clients have been gained through word of mouth. We can also boast an almost 100% repeat business rate, both of which are incredible achievements for a start-up company.

The role:

Part of the wider People Team, the Junior Recruiter will support in recruiting for various roles across the business but also with wider initiatives across the People Team. The role will entail candidate sourcing and screening; posting job adverts and arranging interviews; and managing the ATS database. Nice-to-have skills:

Why you should consider this role:

  • FXC Intelligence is in a very strong position and will continue to grow throughout 2023, despite the prospects of a recession and economic instability in the wider market

  • You will be part of a great team of genuine people who are fun to work with but also extremely driven

What we offer:

We’re an innovative company that knows how to look after its employees and we take pride in providing a flexible working environment, a great company culture and great opportunities for career growth. Have a look at our careers page to find out more about our perks and benefits and to see for yourself what it’s like to work with us: https://careers.fxcintel.com/

Also, why not take a look at our employee engagement blog to see how our colleagues feel about working at FXC Intelligence: https://careers.fxcintel.com/blog/posts/60820-what-do-our-employees-think-of-fxc-intelligence

At FXC Intelligence, we believe in embracing diversity in all of its forms and fostering an inclusive environment. results.title: Senior People Business Partner
results.description:
InfoTrack is committed to hiring the best talent anywhere in the United States. Unless the job requires presence in an office, employees can choose to work entirely from home, an office (Petaluma, CA; Manhattan, NY; Chicago, IL; Denver, CO), or a mixture of the two.


About InfoTrack

InfoTrack is a platform that seamlessly connects law firms to the courts and to the services that they need to litigate successfully. We're global leaders in legal technology with unparalleled expertise in forging integrations that can drastically improve the efficiency of law firms and the legal system.

As a highly ambitious company, we know that our people are critical to our success. That's why we're passionate about fostering a high-performance culture built on professional development, open communication, and transparent leadership. If you're smart, dedicated, and eager to help build a market-leading solution that makes a difference in the lives of our clients, join us.


About the Role

Do you want the opportunity to influence InfoTrack’s people strategy in a way that impacts employees and leaders at InfoTrack? Does the thought of partnering and strategically impacting business objectives excite you? Do opportunities for continuous improvement, optimization, and providing impactful people outcomes to an organization come naturally to you? Are you excited about building strong employee engagement and positive employee experience?

If so, we would love to hear from you! We are looking for a Senior People & Culture Business Partner to join our People & Culture team.

In addition, the ideal candidate will enjoy the following:

  • Talent and performance management
  • Employee engagement
  • Coaching and influencing
  • Employee Relations
  • Business Partnership
  • Project management
  • Leadership

Requirements

What We’re Looking For

Education and Experience

  • Master’s degree in Human Resources or related field or equivalent work experience
  • Minimum of seven (7) years of experience as a Human Resources Business Partner advising and influencing business leaders
  • Minimum of five (5) years of experience in Human Resources Project Management Experience
  • Minimum of five (5) years of employee relations experience
  • Experience working within a software as a service (SaaS) company preferred, in the legal services industry would be an added benefit

Certification(s)

  • Recognized Human Resources certification preferred, such as the Society for Human Resource Management Certified Professional (SHRM-CP), Society for Human Resource Management Senior Certified Professional (SHRM-SCP), Professional in Human Resources (PHR), Senior Professional in Human Resources (SPHR).
  • Project Management Professional (PMP) certification or equivalent preferred

Knowledge and Skills

  • Expert knowledge of employment laws, regulations, and best practices
  • Ability to thrive in a working environment that requires investigation and definition of priorities
  • Strong project and time management skills
  • Ability to leverage technology to stay organized and strive towards efficiency and automation when possible
  • Ability to discern information that is confidential and to maintain confidentiality
  • Inquisitive in nature- always seeks to understand before acting
  • Excellent researcher- can find an answer to a question or solution to a problem
  • Strive to understand the “bigger picture” of organizational goals and how those goals guide our work
  • Ability to influence and partner with different levels of the organization to achieve results
  • Strong business acumen, including strong problem-solving skills, critical thinking, and self-initiative
  • Forward-looking thinker who actively seeks opportunities and proposes action

Travel

Ability to join in-person strategy and team-building events with various teams and divisions across the business a minimum of three times annually. Also, travels to attend hiring events. Additional travel is discretionary.

Benefits

What Sets InfoTrack Apart

We are a remote-friendly company! We encourage you to apply from anywhere in the United States. Whether you choose to work in an office or remotely, we strive to ensure that you have the resources and training that you need to successfully collaborate and succeed. At InfoTrack, we’re committed to a workplace where everyone feels comfortable doing their best work and, yes, having fun! We also believe in a work/life balance that fulfills you while you’re here and supports you when you’re not. We built our benefits package to prove that we’re committed to you having everything you need.

Here is what we offer full-time employees:

  • Medical, Dental, & Vision Insurance- 85% of employee premiums are covered by InfoTrack, and 70% for your family premiums.
  • Employer-funded Short/Long-Term Disability, Life, and Accidental Death & Dismemberment (AD&D) Insurance
  • 20 Days of Paid Time Off (PTO)
  • 11 Paid Holidays
  • 401(k) Match
  • Equity Stock Options for All Employees
  • Monthly Internet Stipend for Remote Employees
  • Matching Corporate Gift Program·
  • PC laptop computer, monitors, mouse, keyboard, and headset
  • Cloud-based phone & a cell phone stipend for select positions
  • Flexibility. Work from home, an office, or a mixture of the two- wherever you’re happiest and able to do your best work.
  • Be part of a culture obsessive about learning, development, and career growth
  • Work with a knowledgeable, high-achieving, experienced, and fun team


Our Commitment

We believe that the key to our success is you. Your unique background, life experience, knowledge, self-expression, and talent make you uniquely you. Who you are, what you have experienced, and how you think inspires us to be innovative and bold.

InfoTrack is an equal-opportunity employer. We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it's the right thing to do but because it makes our company stronger. We welcome the unique contributions that you can bring in terms of your education, opinions, culture, ethnicity, race, ancestry, sex, gender identity and expression, national origin, citizenship, marital status, age, languages are spoken, veteran status, color, religion, disability, sexual orientation, and beliefs.

results.description:
About Us

Outsourced Doers matches trained marketing Virtual Assistants (who we call Doers), with busy, time-poor online entrepreneurs (who we call Founders). With over 1,000 Doers and Founders from over 50 countries, we're helping Founders globally to work less and achieve more. 


About the Role

The primary purpose of the People and Culture Officer is to assist the COO's office in managing the recruitment requirements of the business as well as the people's operational needs.

The People and Culture Officer will work closely with the Executive Team to assist in defining roles, responsibilities and requirements as well as finding ways to attract the right talent.  The outcomes of this role directly impacts the company's culture, strategies and revenue growth.

This role will include working with HR teams in Australia, The Philippines and The USA

Role responsibilities range in nature and complexity, with key components including:

  • You will manage the HR functions for The Outsourced Doers.
  • You will lead the recruitment, onboarding and induction of new team members as well as manage exit interviews.
  • You will provide HR support and advice to the Exec team and be the first point of contact for HR queries.

  • You will embed strong HR, People and Culture practices and procedures into the organisation.
  • You will be responsible for ensuring HR details are kept current and various HR metrics are tracked and reported to ensure a positive team culture is nurtured and maintained. 
     

About You

In addition to the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, balance multiple priorities, work under pressure and meet strict deadlines we are seeking applications from candidates with the following skills and characteristics:

  • Effective people management and communication skills with a high-performance approach to leadership and development.
  • Technical skills in a range of systems and tools such as Seek, LinkedIn, Indeed, Google products, Employment Hero and other HR Platforms
  • Strategic and growth mindset with proactive business approach
  • Ability to Influence, coach and mentor both internal (employees) and stakeholders of the business

To Apply

Please apply by submitting your resume and a cover letter. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

results.title: Head of Talent Acquisition
results.description:
Grow with HiveMQ as we lead IoT messaging and connectivity

We are a fast-growing tech start-up looking to add to our team of innovative and motivated people. HiveMQ is a messaging platform for reliable, secure and scalable data movement to and from connected IoT devices. Our vision is a connected world where people and companies can unleash their full potential. Our flagship product, the HiveMQ MQTT broker, is used by over 130 customers to develop new connected products, improve efficiencies, and drive down costs.

HiveMQ originated in Landshut, Germany, and has grown into a global, remote-first company. The last time we counted, we spoke 32 languages within HiveMQ. Join us as we work to contribute to the fast moving development of the IoT ecosystem and help companies enable mission critical use cases like connected cars, logistics, Industry 4.0 and connected IoT products.

HiveMQ’s Vision for this role       

As we enter our hyper-growth phase, we are looking for a Head of Talent Acquisition to embark on an outstanding journey and join our fully-remote team. In this role, you will contribute significantly to the ambitious growth plans we have and create strong talent networks by finding and engaging with the best talent in Europe, USA and beyond. You are responsible for the critical role hiring and succession plan, as a part of HiveMQs global expansion strategy, you will report to and need to work closely with Global Head of People & Culture to define, develop, and implement recruiting strategies and processes to provide a qualified candidate pool for requisitions. In a Nutshell: In this role, you will have to focus on creating initiatives to ensure the company meets its operational and growth targets.

 

You will…

  • Design and execute recruiting strategies to attract, evaluate and hire qualified candidates
  • Proactively identify and address hiring needs
  • Establish innovative candidate sourcing strategies, especially for hard-to-fill positions;
  • Provide overall leadership for a team of recruiting professionals and act as a strong role model, providing mentorship and motivation for growth;
  • Ensure strategies are designed to meet hiring plans in a timely and consistent fashion;
  • Promote diversity in the workplace and ensure recruiting strategies attract diverse candidates
  • Oversee and improve overall candidate experience
  • Maintain talent pipelines with potential candidates and past applicants for future staffing needs
  • Organize recruitment events to establish a strong employer brand
  • Participate in our company’s strategic planning regarding employee development and engagement
  • Research and recommend new sourcing tools and recruiting software (e.g. Greenhouse)

  • Define, track and analyze talent acquisition metrics and develop practical tracking and reporting methods to monitor and improve performance;
  • Source methods and providers of vendors, products and systems for talent communities; negotiate terms and contracts;
  • Select and oversee tools, technology, and assets used to support highly effective talent acquisition.

 

You have…

  • Direct recruiting experience in a fast pace, high growth in-house technology company or agency firm, prior experience consulting and managing clients in a professional service environment.
  • Strong track record of solving complex problems, designing creative strategies, and delivering significant hiring impact for a business.
  • Strong domain knowledge and expertise in executive search or executive talent acquisition.
  • Excellent attention to detail and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously as well as strong communication and organizational skills.
  • Good judgment and executive presence and ability to interface effectively with senior executives.
  • The ideal candidate is a detail oriented individual with excellent problem-solving skills, executive presence, strong communication skills and a great sense of humor
  • Good in presenting and addressing the right messages towards the executive leaders

Our Technical Recruiter will be a trusted partner to our HR & Leadership Team across the U.S.! We are seeking an enthusiastic, organized self-starter for our key positions throughout the company, with a primary focus on Engineering roles across Chromalloy.

Chromalloy is proud to be an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, veteran's status, or visual, hearing, mental or physical disability.

results.title: People Partner
results.description:
About Us
Merit’s verified identity ecosystem helps trusted organizations across government and enterprise solve critical real-world problems in workforce development, emergency services, licensing, education, defense readiness, and other sectors. Thousands of trusted organizations - including government agencies and nonprofits - use Merit for digital verification of credentials, licenses, training, and skills.
Using Merit, organizations can capture and certify people-data in containers called merits (Watch this video to learn more: What is Merit?), and grant them to individuals. All of an individual’s merits are stored in one place, providing people agency over their verified data, giving people secure access and selective sharing with other organizations.
By connecting organizations and individuals, the Merit Platform supports a robust verified identity network that serves as a source of truth and trust for entire industries; bringing visibility, liquidity, and trust to people’s data.
 
Florida Division of Emergency Management
The Florida Division of Emergency Management partnered with Merit to provide a fast, secure, paperless solution for the verification and time-tracking of thousands of volunteers and paid medical professionals assisting with the statewide COVID-19 vaccination efforts. As a result of our work together, FDEM was named a StateScoop 50 Award winner for the State IT Innovation of the Year.
 
Ohio Department of Education - Afterschool Child Enrichment (ACE) Program
After the Ohio State Legislature created the $125M 2-year Afterschool Child Enrichment (ACE) educational savings account program, the Ohio Department of Education (ODE) contracted Merit to inform parents, guardians, and businesses about the new opportunity and eligibility requirements. Merit developed and delivered support systems, workflows, and digital assets for the ACE program. ODE issued digital credentials to parents and guardians certifying student eligibility, enabling them to use the grants with service providers listed in the Education Marketplace, and the Ohio ACE app is a single destination to view account balances and submit claims.
 
Virginia's Department of Professional and Occupational Regulation (DPOR)
DPOR partnered with Merit to streamline licensing and digital credentialing for the more than 300,000 Virginia’s Department of Professional and Occupational Regulation (DPOR) partnered with Merit to streamline licensing and digital credentialing for the more than 300,000 professionals across more than 40 industries that are required to have a license to work. With Merit, those licenses are now digital, accessible, and easily verifiable by consumers and businesses.
 
Merit’s salaries are competitive and transparent. Here’s a look at our pay bands based on different roles.
 
Our Values
Merit’s values are more than just words on paper – they permeate the company’s brand, culture, products, and even individual actions. Our values are:
Everyone is a friend. We see opportunities everywhere because Merit has endless ways to grow the already vast and self-propagating Verified Identity graph.
Building a network of truth and trust. Merit is modeling the real world of Verified Identity into a digital one, built on merits. Society values truth, and merits represent truth.
A rising tide lifts all boats. We think about entire industries and how to make the most impact on people’s lives. When we succeed, our employees, partners, and everyone on Merit should succeed.
Measure to meaningfully improve. Work is measured by output, not vanity metrics, and the things we do measure have goals.
Use Merit to build Merit. The strength of the Merit network, platform, and company compounds with the addition of every partner, consumer, and employee.
 
The Role
Salary Band: $121,650 - $150,450
 
As a People Partner at Merit, you will join our People Operations team in supporting all Merit employees through their full lifecycle. You will join a highly motivated team in providing excellent support and resources to our workforce to ensure all employees have what they need to be highly successful. You will become a critical part of the growth, satisfaction, and success for employees working remotely around the world. 
 
Merit is a startup environment where you will be expected to roll up your sleeves, take initiative, and get creative about finding solutions to challenges. This is a full-time, 100% remote role with travel up to six times annually.



Responsibilities
  • Conduct regular meetings with assigned business units to provide regular HR support and feedback
  • Support employee onboarding and offboarding
  • Manage employee data in our HRIS system
  • Support employee training including managing training in LMS systems, creating basic training content, facilitating live training sessions, and regularly re-assessing training needs
  • Ensure that company benefits are managed properly and that all Merit employees have the tools and support to get the most out of their benefits
  • Collaborate with People Operations team members to analyze trends and metrics to develop solutions, programs and policies
  • Maintain in-depth knowledge of legal requirements related to day-to-day management of employees, reducing legal risks and ensuring regulatory compliance. Partner with legal resources as required
  • Provide HR policy guidance and interpretation
  • Manage and resolve sensitive employee relations issues purposefully and thoughtfully
  • Conduct effective, thorough, and objective investigations and work with People Ops leadership to identify and complete proper follow-ups
  • Provide day-to-day guidance to assigned business areas including coaching, performance management, disciplinary action, team dynamics, and more
  • Work closely with all merit employees to improve work relationships, build morale, and increase productivity and retention
  • Perform other related duties as assigned.



Qualifications
  • 5+ years in an HR related role
  • SHRM-CP certification
  • Expertise with managing vendor relationships
  • Ability to comprehend, interpret, and apply the appropriate sections of applicable laws, guidelines, regulations, ordinances, and policies
  • Ability to acquire a thorough understanding of the organization's hierarchy, jobs, qualifications, compensation practices, and the administrative practices related to those factors
  • Working knowledge of multiple human resource disciplines, including compensation practices, organizational diagnosis, diversity, performance management, and federal and state respective employment laws
  • Experience with Slack, Google Suite, and HRIS systems.



Soft Skills
  • Strong problem-solving skills. Able to quickly identify problems, assess accuracy and relevance of information, use sound judgment to generate and evaluate potential resolutions, and to make thoughtful recommendations
  • Excellent communication skills. Talent for expressing information to both individuals and groups efficiently and effectively using multiple communication pathways. Able to take into account the audience and nature of the information (technical, sensitive, controversial) and adjust communication accordingly. Strong ability and willingness to practice active listening and to calmly deescalate frustration
  • An eye for detail. A drive to approach all work in a thorough and conscientious manner with the goal of fully understanding scope
  • Best in class customer service. A welcoming and supportive professional presence for all employees and a strong ability to assess individual needs, provide information or assistance to resolve issues or satisfy expectations, calmly and firmly set issues back on track, and show a strong commitment to providing excellent support.
At Merit, we don’t just accept differences, we celebrate, support and value it for the innate benefit of our employees, the competitive advantage of our products, and the strength of the communities we are a part of. Merit is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or veteran status. We will do our best to accommodate any disabilities or special needs you may have.

results.title: Head of Recruitment
results.description:
Templum is a leading FinTech company focused on creating greater efficiencies in the alternative asset sector. While private markets have recently surpassed public markets as it pertains to annual capital raised the infrastructure remains opaque and inefficient. Templum has created an end-to-end solution for the primary issuance and secondary trading of private alternative assets catered to the needs of private market participants. 

We are looking for a dynamic and seasoned recruitment specialist who is as comfortable sourcing developers as they are C- level executives, who appreciates the unique impact they can have as an in-house TA lead, and who is above all, our #1 product enthusiast and evangelist.  

Responsibilities: 

  • Manage end to end strategic and delivery side of Sourcing & Recruiting, from prioritizing headcount planning to scheduling and leading interviews 
  • Collaborate with internal partners to build and execute tailored recruitment strategies on a per-role basis, while at the same time creating repeatable processes 
  • Use metrics to refine and improve upon strategy and process, from recruitment to post-hire 
  • Work with VP of People and other colleagues to perform headcount planning and forecasting 
  • Write job descriptions 
  • Review current interview process with an eye for consistency and compliance, staying ahead of statutory requirements and defining a unique, comprehensive, and positive experience for candidates across the board 
  • Manage social media accounts from a recruitment perspective; work with Marketing and VP of People to build a positive cultural brand 
  • Perform market research and leverage other data to establish and publish salary bands 
  • Build a pipeline of candidates for all potential roles across the organization 
  • Act as an escalation point to business stakeholders for all recruiting-related concerns 
  • Optimize recruiting databases and tools; implement new tools as deemed necessary for optimal efficiency and data analysis 
  • Perform other HR duties unrelated to recruitment as business needs demand them and in close collaboration with VP of People & Culture 

Preferred Skills & Experience 

  • Bachelor's Degree 
  • Passion for Alternative Investments and basic understanding of Capital Markets 
  • 1+ years experience recruiting for a Tech or FinTech firm, across both Tech and non-Tech functions 
  • 4+ years of total experience in recruitment 
  • Experience working with- and ideally implementing- a modern ATS such as Greenhouse, iCIMS, or BreezyHR 
  • Strong understanding of the company's business objectives and organizational structure 
  • Very good understanding of the company's position in the marketplace 
  • Strong understanding of recruiting processes and procedures 
  • Understanding and valuing of metrics and their function in your role 
  • Strong interviewing skills: understanding of human psychology and excellent interpersonal skills 
  • Understanding of recruiting resource and marketing plan 
  • Good understanding of the external marketplace trends 
  • Data analysis experience 
  • Strong team player 
  • Analytical skills and problem-solving skills 

Expected annual base salary for this role is between $100,000 and $130,000 at the commencement of employment. However, base salary, if hired, will be determined on an individualized basis and constitutes only one part of the total rewards and compensation package, which will include a 4% 401K match and health benefits subsidized at 75% by Templum. Depending on the position, total compensation may also include options, commission earnings, incentive compensation, and/or discretionary bonuses. Please note that ancillary benefits are subject to change at any time in the sole discretion of Templum.

Templum truly believes that diversity fosters innovation and we're proud to have a diverse team with a wide variety of backgrounds and experiences. We focus on hiring talented people regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

results.title: Junior Recruiter- Life Cycle Assessment
results.description:
About Vaayu

Vaayu is on a mission to decarbonize retail by helping brands (from fashion and beauty to consumer goods, health and beyond) to track, cut and credibly communicate their climate impact in real time. Our science-based platform provides granular, automated and accurate carbon calculations, powered by over 600,000 activity-based data points that make it easy for brands to understand their emissions and take action throughout the value chain to meet their reduction targets. We believe in the power of technology as a force for good and are looking for game-changers from across Europe (or equivalent time zones) who share our vision of helping retailers reduce 1 gigaton of emissions by 2030. If you want to work at a purpose-driven startup and be part of a team defining state-of-the-art technology that drives down carbon emissions at scale, we'd love to hear from you.
 
Our Values
  • Environmental. The Earth is our protagonist. Protecting it is at the center of everything we do.
  • Collaborative. Climate change affects us all. By working collaboratively we know we can make a difference within retail, and beyond.
  • Honest. Our voice is informative and authentic. We want to share what we are working on, be open about the challenges, and build an ecosystem that creates change.
Requirements
  • You have a degree or comparable relevant experience in recruiting, preferred in Life Cycle Assessment (LCA)
  • You want to learn more about recruiting and talent management
  • You want to understand new business models and are keen to help build our Life Cycle Assessment (LCA)
  • You are open-minded and communicative and can easily adjust to different conversation partners
  • Your experience in customer-related jobs, such as customer service or sales, is a bonus for us and a great basis for you to get started in recruiting
  • You speak fluent English, any other language is an advantage
Your tasks
  • You accompany your candidates through our recruiting process with a focus on a first-class candidate experience
  • You will mainly support our internal recruiting in your early days
  • Your candidates will not only get the standard information in the interviews with you, but you will be able to explain the operational tasks of Vaayu
  • You like to give new input to the team and are passionate about optimising and constantly developing processes.
  • After a detailed onboarding, you will be able to independently enter profiles, approach candidates directly and conduct initial interviews with them

 

Benefits

Vaayu provides the opportunity to:

  • Work at a mission-driven start-up with sustainability experts
  • Receive equity in a fast-growing business with an exciting journey ahead
  • Full remote work from anywhere in Europe
  • Collaborate with a diverse, open-minded, and international team
  • Grow and develop within an expanding team of entrepreneurial experts
  • Join our bi-annually offsite where we come together in a European destination
  • Enjoy 26 days paid leave with an additional day for every year of employment (up to 30 days)
  • Opt-in to pension and health policies available within your region of work

Vaayu is an equal opportunity employer. We do not believe in discrimination of any kind, and are proud to have an international team from over 17 different countries. We nurture an inclusive and collaborative environment for all, and are committed to reflecting a diverse range of backgrounds, experience and thinking.
